title: Question 17
prompt:
Why does the woman “reward [the mirror] with tears” when it reflects her faithfully?

The woman
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: The mirror in the poem is carefully described as truthful and dispassionate. It reflects honestly everything “just as it is, unmisted by love or dislike.” The mirror is faithful, showing the woman how she really looks. She responds with tears, because she dislikes how she looks. She prefers the “liars,” candles and the moon, that can hide her flaws in soft light. Answer A is correct; the woman cries because she doesn’t like how she looks.
